Typography Scale

Complete typography system for testing

Type Scale ($type-size-*)

Type Size 1 - 2.441em (~39px)

Type Size 2 - 1.953em (~31px)

Type Size 3 - 1.563em (~25px)

Type Size 4 - 1.25em (~20px)

Type Size 5 - 1em (~16px) - Base

Type Size 6 - 0.75em (~12px)

Type Size 7 - 0.6875em (~11px)

Type Size 8 - 0.625em (~10px)

Headline Scale ($h-size-*)

Heading 1 - $h-size-1 (1.563em ~25px)

Default H1 styling

Heading 2 - $h-size-2 (1.25em ~20px)

Default H2 styling

Heading 3 - $h-size-3 (1.125em ~18px)

Default H3 styling

Heading 4 - $h-size-4 (1.0625em ~17px)

Default H4 styling
Heading 5 - $h-size-5 (1.03125em ~16.5px)
Default H5 styling
Heading 6 - $h-size-6 (1em ~16px)
Default H6 styling

Body Text Variants

Lead paragraph - Used for introductory text with larger font size and lighter weight.

Body text - Standard paragraph with default font size and weight. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nullam quis risus eget urna mollis ornare vel eu leo.

Small text - Reduced font size for less prominent content.

Muted text - Lighter color for secondary information.

Strong/Bold text - For emphasis within paragraphs.

Italic/Emphasis text - For stylistic emphasis.

Marked/Highlighted text - For highlighting content.

Deleted text and Inserted text

Abbr - For abbreviations with tooltips

Font weight medium (500)

Font weight semibold (600)

Font weight bold (700)

Font weight bolder

Code Typography

Inline code: const theme = 'dark';

Keyboard input: Ctrl + C

Sample output: This is sample output

Variable: x = y + 2

// Preformatted code block
function example() {
  return 'Hello, World!';
}
